Package com.example.recipeoop_1.security

Class JwtUserDetailsService

java.lang.Object
com.example.recipeoop_1.security.JwtUserDetailsService
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
@Service("jwtUserDetailsService") public class JwtUserDetailsService extends Object implements org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
Service implementation for UserDetailsService to load user-specific data.

This service is used by Spring Security to retrieve user details (username, password, authorities) during the authentication process, particularly for JWT-based authentication. In this implementation, user details are stored in-memory in a HashMap. It pre-populates two users: "admin" (with ADMIN and USER roles) and "user" (with USER role). Passwords for these users are encoded using the provided PasswordEncoder.

The bean is named "jwtUserDetailsService" and can be injected using this qualifier.
Since:
2025-05-14

  • Field Details

    • passwordEncoder

      private final org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder
      The PasswordEncoder used for encoding passwords. This is typically injected by Spring.

    • users

      private final Map<String,JwtUserDetailsService.UserInfo> users
      In-memory storage for user information. The key is the username, and the value is a JwtUserDetailsService.UserInfo object containing the hashed password and roles.

  • Constructor Details

    • JwtUserDetailsService

      @Autowired public JwtUserDetailsService(org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder)
      Constructs the JwtUserDetailsService and initializes in-memory users.

      It takes a PasswordEncoder to securely store hashed passwords for the predefined users. Two users are created by default:

      • admin: Password "1234", Roles "ROLE_ADMIN", "ROLE_USER"
      • user: Password "user", Roles "ROLE_USER"
      Parameters:
      passwordEncoder - The PasswordEncoder used for encoding passwords.

  • Method Details

    • loadUserByUsername

      public org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails loadUserByUsername(String username) throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
      Locates the user based on the username.

      This method is called by Spring Security's authentication mechanism. It retrieves user information from the in-memory users map. If the user is found, it constructs and returns a UserDetails object (specifically, a User) containing the username, hashed password, and granted authorities (roles).

      Specified by:
      loadUserByUsername in interface org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
      Parameters:
      username - The username identifying the user whose data is required.
      Returns:
      A fully populated UserDetails object (never null).
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if the user could not be found or the user has no GrantedAuthority. This exception is part of the UserDetailsService contract.
